text.p: Shares in Bre-X Minerals Ltd spiked up more than two points over a half-hour period on Friday amid a wave of market rumors swirling around the company, traders and analysts said.
"There's a rumor a COW is imminent," said one trader. Bre-X rose 2.60 to 23.80 on more than 1.8 million shares in Friday morning trading.

Bre-X, which controls the spectacular Busang gold discovery in Indonesia, has been awaiting crucial contracts of work for months. The Indonesian government has delayed the contracts due to an ownership dispute.
One of Bre-X's Indonesian partners has claimed up to 40 percent of the discovery. The Indonesian government has said it will not issue permits until Bre-X settles the claim.

Bre-X stock has been volatile because of uncertainty over the ownership. Recently Bre-X announced it had formed an alliance with the son of Indonesia's President Suharto to help the company win the permits quickly.
"The market is up because there's a rumor that they will soon have a contract of work," confirmed gold analyst Michael Fowler of Levesque Beaubien Geoffrion. "But those are just rumors."
Bre-X would not comment, maintaining the silence it has held since it announced its alliance with Suharto's son on October 28.
The company is searching for a major mining company to act as an operator and part or full owner of the deposit, but analysts said a deal will likely need to wait until Bre-X won its permits.

"The street is torn. They want to see if Suharto is sitting on all the COWs because he's been told that payoffs will happen," said gold analyst Catherine Gignac with Deacon Capital Corp. "The indications from people close to Bre-X are that it will be resolved quickly."
